This has historical usage stats, not rate limit info. 

I want you to use the real /usage command in Claude code and parse the output

This is fundamental: you must either spin up Claude code in a tmux session you can send remote keystrokes to or
To maintain a session (context) and issue multiple commands (including slash commands) programmatically, you must trick the CLI into thinking it's running in a real terminal. Python's pexpect library is perfect for this.
This script spawns the Claude process, waits for the prompt, sends your command, and captures the output.
See my other comment: may need to be pexpect or tmux
